content.description:
This route climbs the right-hand side of the slab, to the right of a tree island that divides the slab into two portions. 

  P1: Climb poor rock to a pothole above the level of the tree island (5.3 R, 100 feet). 

  P2: Climb straight up the slab above to the top (5.4 R, 150 feet).
content.location: This route climbs the right-hand side of the slab, to the right of a tree island that divides the slab into two portions.

content.description:
Start on the left side of the slab to the left of the tree island. 

  P1: Climb the slab to a scoop and a bolt belay (5.5, 130 feet). 

  P2: Climb out of the scoop (crux) and up the slab above past two bolts to the top (5.5, 150 feet).
content.protection: A few bolts and minimal trad gear.
content.location: Start on the left side of the slab to the left of the tree island.

content.description:
The right-hand of the two slabs across the Saco River from the Frankenstein Cliff/Arethusa Falls parking area. 

  The slab is named after Ethan Crawford, who was born in 1872 and became a famous mountain guide in the White Mountains.
